revised_title: A Critique of the Korteweg-de Vries Equation for Anharmonic Lattices
tldr: The author examines the use of the Korteweg-de Vries equation as a continuum limit for anharmonic lattices and finds that it does not accurately represent the behavior of nonlinear lattices in the long wave limit. Instead, a sixth-order partial differential equation provides a more accurate description of the lattice dynamics. The author discusses the relative accuracies of three forms of the long-wavelength dispersion relation and compares them with exact lattice equations for various potential energy functions.
